docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Some manufacturers of brand-name prescription drugs, alarmed by the success of cheaper generic versions of their products, are waging a counterattack against their competition.

headline.main: DRUG MAKERS FIGHTING BACK AGAINST ADVANCE OF GENERICS

docs.snippet: LEAD: Some manufacturers of brand-name prescription drugs, alarmed by the success of cheaper generic versions of their products, are waging a counterattack against their competition.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: At 2:30 A.M. the corridors of New York Infirmary-Beekman Downtown Hospital were dimly lighted and still. But inside the intensive-care unit the respirators pumped and hummed as usual, sustaining fragile lives.

headline.main: Medical Resident: Life on the Crisis Shift

docs.snippet: LEAD: At 2:30 A.M. the corridors of New York Infirmary-Beekman Downtown Hospital were dimly lighted and still. But inside the intensive-care unit the respirators pumped and hummed as usual, sustaining fragile lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The House of Representatives voted today to protect 31 million elderly and disabled people against the costs of catastrophic illness by approving the largest expansion of Medicare benefits in the program's 22-year history.

headline.main: A MEDICARE SHIELD FOR COSTLY ILLNESS IS VOTED BY HOUSE

docs.snippet: LEAD: The House of Representatives voted today to protect 31 million elderly and disabled people against the costs of catastrophic illness by approving the largest expansion of Medicare benefits in the program's 22-year history.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR, Special to the New York Times
